comments.commentBody:
The 25th Amendment, section 4 begins:
Whenever the Vice President and a majority of either the principal officers of the executive departments or of such other body as Congress may by law provide, transmit to the President pro tempore of the Senate and the Speaker of the House of Representatives their written declaration that the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office, the Vice President shall immediately assume the powers and duties of the office as Acting President...Enough said.

Uh Obama blamed Bush for the economy because it was TRUE or are you simply forgetting who got the U.S. into 2 unfunded wars and then of course Medicare Part D? Sheesh can ANY republican be at least a teensy tiny itty bit honest

If I thought a crime had been committed against my person then I would report it to my local police authority.  Wouldn't you?  There must be several federal agencies with jurisdiction in D.C.  Why doesn't he call Mr. Sessions?   An investigation can be initiated with an inquiry into his sources and why he feels paranoia.

Wait until he starts wanting to see no one and have his meals passed to him through a hole in the door, only by Steve Bannon or Sean Spicer.

What's it going to take to make people get it? He's off his rocker.

And to think he's saluting military personnel and they're forced to salute him?

Pretty bizarre. Hoping nothing happens between now and when he gets carried out.
That's their game plane.  They're exhausting us in the hope that we will not pay attention to the real issues.  No such luck sick man.  We are watching you all the time.

Distraction, distraction.

Be careful and watch what he and his admin are really doing. Environmental destruction by deregulation? Hiding the new Trump-care policy documents? (Wait till you see those!)

Something else being hidden?

Be careful! Distraction, distraction

Both the BBC and The Guardian reported on the FISA Warrants on Jan. 11, 2017. Today, March 7th, both the BBC and The Guardian reported that their was no evidence of any FISA warrants, discrediting their own stories only 8 weeks old.

The NYT and WP also seem to have ignored these widely reported stories, in their "No Evidence" claims.

Of course, President Obama and his chief national security propagandist
Ben Rhodes, both indicated today that the WH never sought FISA warrants, which is a thinly veiled strawman. The IC, FBI, and DOJ filed the FISA warrants, as reported by Heat Street on Nov. 7th, the day before the election.

So we have multiple media outlets and the former POTUS deliberately lying to their readers and the American people. In the case of the former administration, whispers of the term "high crimes and misdemeanors..." come to mind. What was Watergate about??

The same media outlets questioned the sincerity of a Gold Star Family this week, so nothing is beneath them.
News diversion tactic.  Doesn't want us to change the focus on his campaign team dealings with Russia.   Let's investigate Trump's Russia connections!

Yet another psychotic Trump rant based on Breitbart and other insidious sources (as in insidious undoing of our democracy). It is clever even while it is crazy. This cannot go on for another month, never mind four years. Who in the legislative branch - it will have to be a Republican - will shrug-off the timidity in Washington and say, "This man is not fit to govern." ? Except that Barack Obama has sound bearings, this must all be very hard to bear. My sympathies, sir.

Hard to imagine that Obama would be so stupid as to order such a tap unless
he thought there was, in fact, a serious threat to national security, at which point there must have been an investigation that justified a warrant. Just
because Trump is dishonest and willing to cheat to win (as he once said) does not mean that others operate the way he does. And why should anyone
believe anything Trump says about Obama given his years of the birth certificate lie? To say nothing of the lack of judgment and class in publicly insulting a preceding President once one is President. But oh, I forgot that we haven't had any Presidents before the country "finally " has a President in Trump, "finally."
We need a bill demanding taxes and mental health clearance for all future presidents to run for office. This is absurd.
McCarthyism?  Isn't that what Trump's mentor, Roy Cohn, trained him in?

As an attorney, I can see one possible way to restrain the Great Liar-in-Chief: defamation law. Among the tens of millions of Americans who believe every word Trump says, President Obama's reputation has been substantially injured by Trump's claim. The statements are not only false, but -- it certainly appears -- were made either with knowledge of their falsity or with reckless disregard of their truth or falsity, which is the legal standard that applies here. It's hard for a public figure to sue for liable, but no one is free to simply invent libelous statements and utter them without consequence.
I am sure that Obama feels it would be beneath him to credit these lies so far as a lawsuit. But he would be doing the Republic a great service if he were to show Trump that when he invents defamatory lies, he will pay a price for doing so -- perhaps even including substantial money damages. There are few restrains on the Trump regime's rule-by-lie strategy, but defamation law is one of them.
SUE, BABY, SUE!
Yes and he believes Breitbart and Faux News because the intelligence agencies like the NSA, CIA and FBI are all liars.

The NYT does not claim to be the US president. One hopes the bar is higher for presidential behavior--even if the current so-called incumbent consistently succeeds in crawling under that bar.

The circumstantial evidence of the Trump campaign's contacts with Russians grows by the day. Plus the lack of evidence (tax returns) points to the same conclusions.

Is it possible that Trump and his cohorts are actually as
dumb as they seem? That they could play footsi with the
Russians and no one would notice? You don't need a wiretap
to figure out this stinks to high heaven. What a dangerous
group of people.

"In the fall, the F.B.I. examined computer data showing an odd stream of activity between a Trump Organization server and Alfa Bank, one of Russia’s biggest banks, whose owners have longstanding ties to Mr. Putin." And that's where the investigation appears to have stopped.  Really?

When did Trump provide credible evidence of anything? His alternative facts are all inside his head. Just another symptom of narcissistic personality disorder: "Being preoccupied with fantasies about success, power, brilliance."
Trump seems unaware that it is his own self-focused behavior and whining that make him seem unhinged and unstable. Trump appears deeply anxious; he gets more rattled by what he imagines Obama is doing than Obama did all those years that Trump was actually aiming insults and lies at him.
Advertising 101.

A denial from former President Obamas office is normal, he wouldn't be so stupid to order such a surveillance. What about the FBI Director and former Attorney General Lynch, what do they both say, did they go to the FISA Court again? They tried last summer for a warrant to tap Trumps telephones and were denied, did they find new evidence to get a warrant last fall? AG Holder ordered the surveillance of reporters and Fox's James Rosen and his parents had their electronic transmissions and financial records monitored.
This newspaper on a daily basis prints as real news, rumors, unsubstantiated information and leaks from unnamed sources as real news that damage President Trump and his administration. The standards of journalism and fairness seem to be what the unsourced charges are and not the evidence. President Trump is only following those guidelines , its not the nature of the evidence but, the nature of the unsubstantiated charges! Hope to see some more, "Fair & Balanced" reporting on this very important story!

If he has proof it would go a long way toward bolstering his image and credibility and it would set Washington and the nation on it's ear! Since we suspect he does not, it's not as simple as calling it a lie and Mr. Trump a liar. It's a symptom of something far more troubling.

Another wild episode coming up here.
Obviously Trump aides contacts with Russia have been monitored? Why not monitor Trump too?

Obama's answer was carefully worded. He did not say it didn't happen, he just said he didn't order it. That leaves open the possibility that it did happen and Obama knew about it.

Trump seems deranged, however. Someone should take away his tweeter.
Yes, that's interesting by which I mean totally utterly paranoiacally crazy.  But returning now to Planet Earth, what about your Russian connections?

We should all come to the conclusion that it is a waste of time trying to rationalize to Trump supporters;  by default you need to be irrational to consider him as presidential.   The only way the majority of his supporters will be convinced they have been conned is when their jobs don't come back and and at the same time their safety net (i.e. Obamacare,  medicaid) has been dismantled. Give it 16 months.
I don't know what more evidence the Republicans need before exercising Amendment 25. The guy is just not all there.
